page.title: 03HISTORY OF RANBY TODAY
page.content: THE AREA HAS CHANGED LITTLE FROM THOSE DAYS AS SHOWN ON PAGES 1 AND 2. THE MAJOR PART OF THE AREA OF OUR SURVEY WAS OWNED BY THE DUKE OF NEWCASTLE AND WAS WELL KNOWN FOR A GOOD GAME SHOOTING AREA.THE DUKE SOLD THE LAND TO CHARLES LONGBOTTOM WHO IN TURN SOLD IT TO SIR ALBERT BINGHAM WHO MADE CUTLERY IN SHEFFIELD. THE ESTATE WAS BROKEN UP IN 1948 AND SOLD OFF IN LOTS.RANBY HOUSE BECAME A PRIVATE SCHOOL AND THE MAJOR PART OF THE REMAINING LAND TAKEN OVER AS SMALL PRIVATE FARMS. MORTON HALL REMAINED IN THE MASON FAMILY,THIS BEING BOUGHT IN 1820. LADY MASON STILL LIVES AND MANAGES THE ESTATE.FAR FEWER PEOPLE LIVE IN THE AREA NOW. THE PRESENT RANBY PRIMARY SCHOOL ONLY HAS 30 PUPILS ON ITS BOOKS,NOW BEING A CONTROLLED C OF E PRIMARY 25 OF THOSE PUPILS ARE BUSED IN.
